res.title: Nicoise salad
ingredients: 4 small boneless skinless chicken breasts (1 lb.)
res.make: Cuire les oeufs, les faire durcir. Pendant 6 à 8 minutes après ébullition de l'eau. Les faire refroidir à l'eau froide.Hacher les cébettes et les mettre au fond plat.Ajouter les févettes, le poivron vert finement coupé. Ajouter les radis coupés en rondelles, le thon bien égoutté et émietté. Remuer grossièrement tous les ingrédients en ajoutant du sel et du poivre.

res.title: Santa Fee Chicken Recipe
ingredients: 1 can (10-1/2 oz.) condensed cream of chicken soup
4 small boneless skinless chicken breasts (1 lb.)
1/2 cup TACO BELL Thick & Chunky Salsa
res.make: Enlevez la peau du saumon.Coupez en dés le poisson et ajoutez y une échalote finement hachée. Mélangez puis incorporez un jus d'1 citron, un peu de persil, un peu de gingembre, du cornichon haché ou des câpres. Assaisonnez avec 1 pointe de tabasco, du sel, et du poivre du moulin.Servez sur des toasts grillés

res.title: Mac and Cheese Taco
ingredients: 1 pkg. (7-1/4 oz.) KRAFT Macaroni & Cheese Dinner
1/2 cup TACO BELL® Thick & Chunky Salsa
1/2 cup KRAFT 2% Milk Shredded Cheddar Cheese
res.make: 1 Brown meat in large skillet on medium-high heat; drain. Add Macaroni, water, salsa and Cheese Sauce Mix; mix well. Bring to boil. Cook on medium-low heat 15 min., stirring occasionally.  2 Spoon into taco shells.  3  Top evenly with shredded cheese and tomatoes.

res.title: Potatoes Chorreadas Style
ingredients: 3/4 cup BREAKSTONE'S or KNUDSEN Sour Cream
1/2 cup KRAFT Shredded Low-Moisture Part-Skim Mozzarella Cheese
res.make: 1Boil potatoes until fork-tender; drain. Cover to keep warm. 2  Heat dressing in large skillet on medium-high heat. Add tomatoes and onions; cook and stir 5 minutes or until onions are tender. Reduce heat to low. Add sour cream and seasonings; stir until well blended. 3Pour sauce over warm potatoes; sprinkle with cheese.

res.title: Puerto Rican-Style Stuffed Potatoes
ingredients: 2/3 cup KRAFT Shredded Sharp Cheddar Cheese
res.make: 1 Cook potatoes in boiling water 20 min. or until tender; drain. Place in medium bowl. Mash until smooth. Stir in cracker crumbs. Refrigerate 1 hour or until chilled.  Heat dressing in medium skillet on medium heat. Add peppers and cilantro; cook 5 min., stirring occasionally. Add chicken and olives; stir. Remove from heat; stir in cheese. 3Heat oil in medium saucepan to 375ºF. Shape potato mixture into 5-inch patties with lightly floured hands, using about 1/3 cup of the potato mixture for each patty. Spoon about 1/4 cup chicken mixture onto center of each patty. Fold edges of patties over chicken mixture to completely enclose filling. Shape each into oval shape, resembling a large potato. Add, two at a time, to hot oil; cook 5 to 6 min. or until golden brown. Drain well. Serve warm.

res.title: Santa Fe Chicken Recipe
ingredients: 1 can (10-1/2 oz.) condensed cream of chicken soup
4 small boneless skinless chicken breasts (1 lb.)
1/2 cup TACO BELL® Thick & Chunky Salsa
1 cup KRAFT Mexican Style Finely Shredded Four Cheese
res.make: 1 Heat oven to 400°F. 2Combine rice, beans and peppers in 13x9-inch baking dish. Mix soup, water and cilantro; pour over rice mixture. 3Top with chicken and salsa. 4Bake 45 min. or until chicken is done (165°F), topping with cheese for the last 10 min.

res.title: Argentinean Stuffed Flank Steak
ingredients: 1/2 cup chopped roasted Anaheim chiles or poblano peppers
1 medium unpeeled potato, cut into thin strips
res.make: 1 Place steak in shallow glass dish or large resealable plastic bag. Top with onions and steak sauce; cover. Refrigerate at least one hour to marinate 2 Place steak on cutting board; cover with plastic wrap. Pound with rolling pin or meat mallet until slightly flattened. Remove plastic wrap. Combine dressing, parsley and garlic; spread evenly onto steak. Top with peppers and potatoes. Roll up tightly, starting at one of the short ends. Tie securely with kitchen string at second intervals.3Cook bacon in large skillet on medium heat. Remove bacon from skillet, reserving drippings in skillet. Set bacon aside. Add steak to skillet; cook until browned on all sides, turning occasionally

res.title: Mexican Stuffed Flank Steak
ingredients: 1/2 cup KRAFT Zesty Italian Dressing, divided
4 slices OSCAR MAYER Bacon, cooked, drained and chopped
res.make: Mix potatoes, carrots, serrano chiles, bacon and 2 Tbsp. of the cilantro; set aside. Remove steak from marinade; reserve marinade in bag. Place steak on clean work surface. Spread evenly with potato mixture to within 1/2 inch of edges. Roll up tightly, starting at one of the short ends. Tie securely with kitchen string at 2-inch intervals; set aside.

res.title: Marinated Steak with Chimichurri Sauce
res.make: 1 Pour marinade over steak in shallow dish; turn to coat both sides of steak. Refrigerate 30 min. to marinate. Meanwhile, blend remaining ingredients in blender until smooth. Pour into bowl; refrigerate until ready to serve.2 Heat broiler. Remove steak from marinade; discard marinade. Place steak on rack of broiler pan sprayed with cooking spray.3 Broil, 4 inches from heat, 10 min. or until steak is medium doneness, turning after 5 min. Diagonally cut steak across the grain into thin slices. Serve with the parsley mixture..

res.title: Stuffed Tuscan Flank Steak
ingredients: 1/2 cup KRAFT Grated Parmesan Cheese, divided
res.make: 1 Melt 1 Tbsp. butter in large ovenproof skillet on medium-high heat. Add vegetables; cook and stir 5 to 7 min. or until crisp-tender. Remove from heat.2Stir in croutons, water and half the cheese.3 Use sharp knife to partially cut steak horizontally in half, starting at thickest side of steak and being careful not to cut through to opposite side of steak. Open steak. Spread vegetable mixture onto one cut side of steak; roll up, starting at one long side. Tie closed with kitchen string.  4Melt remaining butter in same skillet. Add meat; cook 7 to 8 min. or until evenly browned, turning occasionally. Place skillet in oven.
